summary: I USED MY ORIGINAL JACK TO LIFT THE VEHICLE TO CHANGE THE FRONT,  LEFT TIRE.  WHILE LOWERING THE VEHICLE, THE JACK SUDDENLY GAVE  OUT WITH THE SOUND OF STRIPPING THREADS, AND THE CAR SLAMMED TO  THE GROUND.  FORTUNATELY, NO PART OF MY BODY WAS UNDER THE CAR,  AND THE TIRE WAS IN PLACE.  IDENTIFYING INFORMATION ON THE FAULTY JACK:    WHERE THE CRANK MEETS THE BOLT:  5J 29 2    AT THE OPPOSITE END OF THE BOLT:  00492    AT THE BASE OF THE JACK:  2549  NOTE: I WAS DOING THIS IN MY GARAGE, ON A FLAT, CONCRETE SURFACE.  THE JACK REMAINED ON ITS BASE THE ENTIRE TIME - IT DID NOT TIP OVER.*JB
